answers.answer: Sexual transmission of a yeast infection is uncommon but possible. If you and the same partner are having unprotected sex he could have it and you continue to get it again. May be worth a shot to have him treated as well.
Also tell your doctor that it won't go away. Continued use of antifungals won't cure the problem if it is systemic. Your doctor can find the source of the yeast and treat the cause :)

I agree your partner my have it and you are getting it repeatedly from him. He needs to be treated as well. Another thing mom wondering have you been checked for diabete? There is a connection between diabetes and reoccurring yeast infections, if you continue with this please ask your doctor to do a fasting glucose test. I hope this helps. Please keep me posted.

question: For the past year I've had a yeast infection every month. My doctor has giving me Diflucan and it clears it up a bit but it always comes back. It has ruined my sex life. There is white chunky discharge, uncontrollable itchiness, and it feels irritated down there and it is very red. I don't know what to do. I was on birth control but stopped taking it hoping it would help but nope! I don't know what to do anymore. I've never had a yeast infection until it appeared a year ago after a regular check up at my obgyn to change my birth control at the time. I am desperate!! I just want to go back to how things were a year ago, everything was normal down there!
title: Year Long Yeast Infection
